intro: Gnaphalium radians, commonly known as the common cudweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in moist habitats such as meadows, marshes, and along stream banks. Its small, white to yellowish flowers are surrounded by pale green bracts, and it produces tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Gnaphalium radians is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
